Comments_List: Czech is awesome! You learn the difficult language in a low-stress environment.
Expanded upon our knowledge and understanding of Czech language and culture from Czech I and II.

Strengths -- encourages failing and trying again. Very rare for a course at Yale. One of the more interactive courses you can take here. 
Weaknesses -- a bit unorganized. You are not sure what grade you will get.

A great learning environment where students felt comfortable to participate. Although it felt a little unorganized at times, professor von Kunes did a great job of preparing and teaching the material.
Yes, if you want to learn Czech, no better environment to do so.
